019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import com.google.gson.JsonObject;
022import io.kubernetes.client.apimachinery.GroupVersionKind;
023import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
024import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1ObjectMeta;
025import io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch;
026import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.options.ListOptions;
027import java.io.IOException;
028import java.time.Instant;
029import java.util.ArrayList;
030import java.util.Comparator;
031import java.util.Optional;
032import java.util.Set;
033import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean;
034import java.util.logging.Level;
035import java.util.stream.Collectors;
036import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_GROUP;
037import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM;
038import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8s;
039import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sClient;
040import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicStub;
041import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sObserver.ResponseType;
042import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sV1ConfigMapStub;
043import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sV1PodStub;
044import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sV1StatefulSetStub;
045import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinition;
046import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinitionModel;
047import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinitionModels;
048import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinitionStub;
049import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmPool;
050import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.APP_NAME;
051import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_NAME;
052import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.AssignVm;
053import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.ChannelManager;
054import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.GetPools;
055import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.GetVms;
056import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.GetVms.VmData;
057import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.ModifyVm;
058import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmChannel;
059import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged;
060import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.util.GsonPtr;
061import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
062import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
063import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
064
065/**
066 * Watches for changes of VM definitions.
067 */
068@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis", "PMD.ExcessiveImports" })
069public class VmMonitor extends
070        AbstractMonitor<VmDefinitionModel, VmDefinitionModels, VmChannel> {
071
072    private final ChannelManager<String, VmChannel, ?> channelManager;
073
074    /**
075     * Instantiates a new VM definition watcher.
076     *
077     * @param componentChannel the component channel
078     * @param channelManager the channel manager
079     */
080    public VmMonitor(Channel componentChannel,
081            ChannelManager<String, VmChannel, ?> channelManager) {
082        super(componentChannel, VmDefinitionModel.class,
083            VmDefinitionModels.class);
084        this.channelManager = channelManager;
085    }
086
087    @Override
088    protected void prepareMonitoring() throws IOException, ApiException {
089        client(new K8sClient());
090
091        // Get all our API versions
092        var ctx = K8s.context(client(), VM_OP_GROUP, "", VM_OP_KIND_VM);
093        if (ctx.isEmpty()) {
094            logger.severe(() -> "Cannot get CRD context.");
095            return;
096        }
097        context(ctx.get());
098
099        // Remove left over resources
100        purge();
101    }
102
103    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CognitiveComplexity")
104    private void purge() throws ApiException {
105        // Get existing CRs (VMs)
106        var known = K8sDynamicStub.list(client(), context(), namespace())
107            .stream().map(stub -> stub.name()).collect(Collectors.toSet());
108        ListOptions opts = new ListOptions();
109        opts.setLabelSelector(
110            "app.kubernetes.io/managed-by=" + VM_OP_NAME + ","
111                + "app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME);
112        for (var context : Set.of(K8sV1StatefulSetStub.CONTEXT,
113            K8sV1ConfigMapStub.CONTEXT)) {
114            for (var resStub : K8sDynamicStub.list(client(), context,
115                namespace(), opts)) {
116                String instance = resStub.model()
117                    .map(m -> m.metadata().getName()).orElse("(unknown)");
118                if (!known.contains(instance)) {
119                    resStub.delete();
120                }
121            }
122        }
123    }
124
125    @Override
126    protected void handleChange(K8sClient client,
127            Watch.Response<VmDefinitionModel> response) {
128        V1ObjectMeta metadata = response.object.getMetadata();
129        AtomicBoolean toBeAdded = new AtomicBoolean(false);
130        VmChannel channel = channelManager.channel(metadata.getName())
131            .orElseGet(() -> {
132                toBeAdded.set(true);
133                return channelManager.createChannel(metadata.getName());
134            });
135
136        // Get full definition and associate with channel as backup
137        var vmModel = response.object;
138        if (vmModel.data() == null) {
139            // ADDED event does not provide data, see
140            // https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/issues/3215
141            vmModel = getModel(client, vmModel);
142        }
143        VmDefinition vmDef = null;
144        if (vmModel.data() != null) {
145            // New data, augment and save
146            vmDef = client.getJSON().getGson().fromJson(vmModel.data(),
147                VmDefinition.class);
148            addDynamicData(channel.client(), vmDef, channel.vmDefinition());
149            channel.setVmDefinition(vmDef);
150        }
151        if (vmDef == null) {
152            // Reuse cached (e.g. if deleted)
153            vmDef = channel.vmDefinition();
154        }
155        if (vmDef == null) {
156            logger.warning(() -> "Cannot get defintion for "
157                + response.object.getMetadata());
158            return;
159        }
160        if (toBeAdded.get()) {
161            channelManager.put(vmDef.name(), channel);
162        }
163
164        // Create and fire changed event. Remove channel from channel
165        // manager on completion.
166        VmDefChanged chgEvt
167            = new VmDefChanged(ResponseType.valueOf(response.type),
168                channel.setGeneration(response.object.getMetadata()
169                    .getGeneration()),
170                vmDef);
171        if (ResponseType.valueOf(response.type) == ResponseType.DELETED) {
172            chgEvt = Event.onCompletion(chgEvt,
173                e -> channelManager.remove(e.vmDefinition().name()));
174        }
175        channel.pipeline().fire(chgEvt, channel);
176    }
177
178    private VmDefinitionModel getModel(K8sClient client,
179            VmDefinitionModel vmDef) {
180        try {
181            return VmDefinitionStub.get(client, context(), namespace(),
182                vmDef.metadata().getName()).model().orElse(null);
183        } catch (ApiException e) {
184            return null;
185        }
186    }
187
188    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals")
189    private void addDynamicData(K8sClient client, VmDefinition vmDef,
190            VmDefinition prevState) {
191        // Maintain (or initialize) the resetCount
192        vmDef.extra("resetCount",
193            Optional.ofNullable(prevState).map(d -> d.extra("resetCount"))
194                .orElse(0L));
195
196        // Node information
197        // Add defaults in case the VM is not running
198        vmDef.extra("nodeName", "");
199        vmDef.extra("nodeAddress", "");
200
201        // VM definition status changes before the pod terminates.
202        // This results in pod information being shown for a stopped
203        // VM which is irritating. So check condition first.
204        if (!vmDef.conditionStatus("Running").orElse(false)) {
205            return;
206        }
207        var podSearch = new ListOptions();
208        podSearch.setLabelSelector("app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME
209            + ",app.kubernetes.io/component=" + APP_NAME
210            + ",app.kubernetes.io/instance=" + vmDef.name());
211        try {
212            var podList
213                = K8sV1PodStub.list(client, namespace(), podSearch);
214            for (var podStub : podList) {
215                var nodeName = podStub.model().get().getSpec().getNodeName();
216                vmDef.extra("nodeName", nodeName);
217                logger.fine(() -> "Added node name " + nodeName
218                    + " to VM info for " + vmDef.name());
219                @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
220                var addrs = new ArrayList<String>();
221                podStub.model().get().getStatus().getPodIPs().stream()
222                    .map(ip -> ip.getIp()).forEach(addrs::add);
223                vmDef.extra("nodeAddresses", addrs);
224                logger.fine(() -> "Added node addresses " + addrs
225                    + " to VM info for " + vmDef.name());
226            }
227        } catch (ApiException e) {
228            logger.log(Level.WARNING, e,
229                () -> "Cannot access node information: " + e.getMessage());
230        }
231    }
232
233    /**
234     * Returns the VM data.
235     *
236     * @param event the event
237     */
238    @Handler
239    public void onGetVms(GetVms event) {
240        event.setResult(channelManager.channels().stream()
241            .filter(c -> event.name().isEmpty()
242                || c.vmDefinition().name().equals(event.name().get()))
243            .filter(c -> event.user().isEmpty() && event.roles().isEmpty()
244                || !c.vmDefinition().permissionsFor(event.user().orElse(null),
245                    event.roles()).isEmpty())
246            .filter(c -> event.fromPool().isEmpty()
247                || c.vmDefinition().assignedFrom()
248                    .map(p -> p.equals(event.fromPool().get())).orElse(false))
249            .filter(c -> event.toUser().isEmpty()
250                || c.vmDefinition().assignedTo()
251                    .map(u -> u.equals(event.toUser().get())).orElse(false))
252            .map(c -> new VmData(c.vmDefinition(), c))
253            .toList());
254    }
255
256    /**
257     * Assign a VM if not already assigned.
258     *
259     * @param event the event
260     * @throws ApiException the api exception
261     * @throws InterruptedException 
262     */
263    @Handler
264    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
265    public void onAssignVm(AssignVm event)
266            throws ApiException, InterruptedException {
267        VmPool vmPool = null;
268        while (true) {
269            // Search for existing assignment.
270            var assignedVm = channelManager.channels().stream()
271                .filter(c -> c.vmDefinition().assignedFrom()
272                    .map(p -> p.equals(event.fromPool())).orElse(false))
273                .filter(c -> c.vmDefinition().assignedTo()
274                    .map(u -> u.equals(event.toUser())).orElse(false))
275                .findFirst();
276            if (assignedVm.isPresent()) {
277                var vmDef = assignedVm.get().vmDefinition();
278                event.setResult(new VmData(vmDef, assignedVm.get()));
279                return;
280            }
281
282            // Get the pool definition for retention time calculations
283            if (vmPool == null) {
284                vmPool = newEventPipeline().fire(new GetPools()
285                    .withName(event.fromPool())).get().stream().findFirst()
286                    .orElse(null);
287                if (vmPool == null) {
288                    return;
289                }
290            }
291
292            // Find available VM.
293            var pool = vmPool;
294            assignedVm = channelManager.channels().stream()
295                .filter(c -> isAssignable(pool, c.vmDefinition()))
296                .sorted(Comparator.comparing(c -> c.vmDefinition()
297                    .assignmentLastUsed().orElse(Instant.ofEpochSecond(0))))
298                .findFirst();
299
300            // None found
301            if (assignedVm.isEmpty()) {
302                return;
303            }
304
305            // Assign to user
306            var vmDef = assignedVm.get().vmDefinition();
307            var vmStub = VmDefinitionStub.get(client(),
308                new GroupVersionKind(VM_OP_GROUP, "", VM_OP_KIND_VM),
309                vmDef.namespace(), vmDef.name());
310            vmStub.updateStatus(from -> {
311                JsonObject status = from.status();
312                var assignment = GsonPtr.to(status).to("assignment");
313                assignment.set("pool", event.fromPool());
314                assignment.set("user", event.toUser());
315                assignment.set("lastUsed", Instant.now().toString());
316                return status;
317            });
318
319            // Make sure that a newly assigned VM is running.
320            fire(new ModifyVm(vmDef.name(), "state", "Running",
321                assignedVm.get()));
322        }
323    }
324
325    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.SimplifyBooleanReturns")
326    private boolean isAssignable(VmPool pool, VmDefinition vmDef) {
327        // Check if the VM is in the pool
328        if (!vmDef.pools().contains(pool.name())) {
329            return false;
330        }
331
332        // Check if the VM is not in use
333        if (vmDef.consoleConnected()) {
334            return false;
335        }
336
337        // If not assigned, it's usable
338        if (vmDef.assignedTo().isEmpty()) {
339            return true;
340        }
341
342        // Check if it is to be retained
343        if (vmDef.assignmentLastUsed()
344            .map(lu -> pool.retainUntil(lu))
345            .map(ru -> Instant.now().isBefore(ru)).orElse(false)) {
346            return false;
347        }
348
349        // Additional check in case lastUsed has not been updated
350        // by PoolMonitor#onVmDefChanged() yet ("race condition")
351        if (vmDef.condition("ConsoleConnected")
352            .map(cc -> cc.getLastTransitionTime().toInstant())
353            .map(t -> pool.retainUntil(t))
354            .map(ru -> Instant.now().isBefore(ru)).orElse(false)) {
355            return false;
356        }
357        return true;
358    }
359}
